words.definition: An addict is a person who cannot stop doing or having something.
words.example: She was a coffee addict. She had more than three cups each day.

words.definition: When something is archeological, it relates to archeology.
words.example: They found archeological evidence that proved an ancient species of man.

words.definition: Archeology is the study of ancient people through their artifacts.
words.example: He studied archeology to learn more about ancient Egyptian culture.

words.definition: To brainstorm is to have a lot of ideas about a certain topic.
words.example: The students met after school to brainstorm ideas for their project.

words.definition: A budget is the amount of money available to be spent for a particular purpose.
words.example: The family has a strict budget for their vacation.

words.definition: When something is chaotic, it is in a state of total confusion and lack of order.
words.example: The city streets were chaotic after the power went out.

words.definition: To cite something means to mention it as an example or proof of something else.
words.example: The lawyer cited a previous case to support his argument.

words.definition: To correspond is to match or be similar to something else; or to communicate by mail.
words.example: The numbers on the map correspond to the locations listed below.

words.definition: A courtyard is an open area that is surrounded by buildings or walls.
words.example: We sat in the courtyard and enjoyed the afternoon sun.

words.definition: An estate is a large area of land owned by one person or family.
words.example: He inherited a large estate from his grandfather.

words.definition: Fraud is the crime of getting money by deceiving people.
words.example: The man was arrested for committing credit card fraud.

words.definition: Hydrogen is a gas that has no color or smell and is the lightest of all elements.
words.example: Water is made of oxygen and hydrogen.

words.definition: Integrity is the quality of being honest and having strong moral principles.
words.example: The principal is a man of great integrity.

words.definition: To knit is to make clothes from wool or cotton by using long needles.
words.example: My grandmother taught me how to knit a scarf.

words.definition: An outlook is a personâ€™s way of thinking about the world; or a future situation.
words.example: He has a positive outlook on life.

words.definition: A parachute is a piece of equipment that allows someone to fall slowly from an aircraft.
words.example: The pilot used a parachute to escape the falling plane.

words.definition: When something is prehistoric, it relates to the time before written history.
words.example: Dinosaurs were prehistoric animals.

words.definition: A proponent is a person who supports an idea or a plan.
words.example: He is a strong proponent of using solar energy.

words.definition: To refine something means to make it better or pure by making small changes.
words.example: The scientist refined his theory after more research.

words.definition: To restrict something means to limit it and keep it within a certain size or amount.
words.example: The new law restricts smoking in public places.
